item.title: FNAF: Secret of the Mimic: Moon Mini-Game Walkthrough (Secret Ending)
item.description:
Similar to previous Five Nights at Freddy's entries, Secret of the Mimic also has a mini-game that players can find installed on all the Helper terminals. The Moon mini-game begins with a person trapped in a room, searching for a way to escape their captivity. While players can try different combinations of choices at the start, the game cannot be completed unless they find most of the Giftbox collectibles and send them down the inventory tubes. So, let's check out how you can complete the Moon mini-game and get the secret ending in Secret of the Mimic .

Which Collectibles Do You Need for the Moon.exe Mini-Game?

There are a total of 25 giftbox memorabilia collectibles that players can collect in FNAF: Secret of the Mimic . While collecting all the giftbox items is essential to getting the trophy, having all of them isn't required to get the secret ending. Here's a list of giftbox items you should have before attempting to complete the Moon.exe mini-game.

Players can gather only 24 collectibles in their first playthrough, as the (White) Tiger Plush can only be acquired at the start of New Game+.

  • Sharpy Plushie
  • Hedgehog Mask
  • Chica Party Time Cup
  • Swing Bee Honey Bottle
  • Star Orphan Night Light
  • Ranger Army Knife
  • Lil Sewing Kit
  • Toy Hammer
  • Fall Fest Ticket Book
  • Junior Doctorâ€™s Kit
  • Pet Fish Net
  • Rainy Day Boot
  • Birthday Cake
  • David's Toy Ball
  • Foxy Pirate Plush
  • Blocks
  • Tiger Plush

How to Complete the Moon.exe Mini-game in FNAF: Secret of the Mimic

Once you have all the collectibles, interact with any Helper terminal in the game and start the Moon.exe program on it. Here's the sequence of item interactions you'll need to do to complete the mini-game and progress towards the secret ending of FNAF: Secret of the Mimic .

Players can press the left or right buttons to switch areas/scenes in the mini-game. See the name of the scene/area to the top left of the terminal's screen, to reference the actions mentioned below.

Closet

Open the closet door to get the Hedgehog mask and wear it afterward.

Bedroom Door

Interact with the Sharpy Plushie to get a key that you can use to open the window and escape the room.

West Forest Path

Interact with the nest outside and get the Chica Party Time Cup from it.

Forest Cave

Pick up the Starbright Night Light and pour the soup from the cauldron into the cup.

East Forest Path

Throw the soup at the gator to save the owl. Also, examine the tree to get a Ranger's Knife.

West Forest Path

Use the knife on the branch to make a Walking Stick.

East Forest Path

Enter Forest Ruins.

Dark Forest Ruins

Examine the statues and take the Bowtie off one.

Dark Forest

Walk down to the Pond.

Dark Forest Pond

Examine the Toy Pirate Ship and take the Foxy Puppet. Later, walk back to the boulder.

Dark Forest Fountain

Examine the Loom and take the Sewing Kit.

Dark Forest Path

Look at the Hollow Stump and get the Swing Bee Honey Bottle. Later, use the Walking Stick to head up the mountain.

Dark Forest Cabin

Give the Honey Bottle to the bear to make it go away. Later, open the cabin door.

Inside Cabin

Talk to the old woman inside and

Mask Workbench

Fix Fox, Rabbit, and Bear's masks on the workbench using items you'll already have collected. Once done, talk to the old woman again to get the Baby Owl Mask.

Forest Cave

Put on the Baby Owl Mask and enter the cave.

Cave Entrance

Enter the east passage.

Cave Ruins

Head deeper into the cave.

Cave Workshop

Get the Toy Hammer from the workbench. Later, head deeper into the cave.

Cave Hub

Enter the north arch from the hub first.

Crystal Cave

Use the hammer on the crystal to get the statue's left arm. Later, open the small door and memorize the arrows on the wall. Now, return to the Cave hub.

Cave Hub

Insert the statue's left arm and head into the west arch and keep heading deeper.

Pirate Ship

Examine the Pirate Ship to get the fishing net. Later, examine the waterfall to walk through it and find a locked chest. Use the combination from the wall before unlocking the chest, i.e., Left, Right, Right, Left. Take the statue's right from within. Now, head back to the Cave Hub.

Cave Hub

Insert the statue's right arm and enter the East Arch.

Cave Pool

Use the fishing net to pull the moon-shaped statue's head out of the pond.

Cave Hub

Insert the statue's head to get teleported to the facility within the Moon.exe mini-game in FNAF: Secret of the Mimic .

Welcome Show

Take the Ticket from the animatronic and open the Security Door.

Jackie's Showroom

Examine the crate to get magical Rainy Day Boots. Later, trap Jackie in the boots. Now, open the Birthday Present to get children's blocks that spell out David. Lastly, exit the showroom using the vent.

Big Top Showroom

Give the ticket to Big Top and claim a Child's Ball from the gift. Later, spin the wheel to open the Rainbow Doors and proceed ahead.

Doll Hospital

Pick up the Doctor's Kit and fix the broken Duck and Elephant. Later, Nurse Dollie will leave, and players can pick up the Birthday Cake. Now, exit the area through the elevator.

Chica's Party Room

Give the Birthday Cake to Chica and open the Birthday Present to get a White Tiger Doll. Next, climb up the stairs.

David's Room

Read the storybook to get a hint on how to solve this puzzle.

  • Place the Child's Ball into the Moon Box.
  • Place the Blocks into the Star Box.
  • Place the White Tiger Doll in the Snow Box.

Walk into the closet when the puzzle is done.

David's Closet

Complete the upgrade station's bits mini-game to get the Glitched Permission.

Once you have the Glitched Permission, the Moon.exe mini-game will be completed in FNAF: Secret of the Mimic . Now, you can get the secret ending by normally completing the game and heading into Edwin's House. However, instead of collecting the tapes to get the code for Edwin's room, you'll need to open the doors with strange access panels and collect six audio tapes .

Once all the tapes are inserted into the tape recorders on the second floor, a secret vent will open up that will lead players into David's room, and towards the game's secret ending.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Dune: Awakening - Regaining Control Quest Guide
item.description:
Regaining Control is the second quest players need to complete to unlock Advanced Trooper skills in Dune: Awakening . Here, players are tasked with finding a man named Tuco for Kara, but as per the usual song and dance in Arrakis, things don't exactly go as planned.

This is part of a relatively long questline similar to the one for the Planetologist and other classes in Dune: Awakening . In this guide, we'll be showing you how to complete the two most confusing parts of this quest so you can start upgrading your favorite Trooper skills as soon as possible.

Before you set out for this quest, make sure to have a Resource Scanner on your Sandbike or in your inventory.

Meeting Hannivar

The first part of this quest will send you to Hannivar's , a lounge in Harko Village. Its owner/bartender should have some information about Tuco, but she won't tell you anything until you find the dead drop ledger in the adjacent room . Ignore Hannivar's warnings about hostile smugglers and just read the ledger, then speak with her again after.

Scan for Clues in Regaining Control Quest

Next, you'll need to go to Jabal Eifrit Al-janub to find Tuco's stash . Follow the marker on your map, and you'll soon arrive at an abandoned camp on a little island-alcove surrounded by quicksand. This is where the scanner comes in â€” use your scanner at the small box with the flashing light, then interact with it. Once you pick up the clue from the box, your next stop will be a mining facility deep within Hagga Rift.

Finding Tuco's Body

For this part of the step, you need to find Tuco inside CHOAM Mineral Extraction Facility #6 . This facility is marked on your map â€” it's at the very bottom of the chasm, so if you can, bring an Ornithopter to make entering and leaving the area easier. Otherwise, you'll have to make your way back to the surface on-foot or through the mining tunnels.

Enter the facility entrance, then get up the ledge that leads to an irradiated area. Radiation in Dune: Awakening will kill you instantly if you let it build up completely, but thankfully, you won't need to stay here long. Follow the quest marker on your compass until you reach a parked Sandbike next to a body that's strung up near the cave wall. Interact with it, then go back to Arrakeen and tell Kara what you found. This marks the end of Regaining Control.

Finishing this quest will let you upgrade your Trooper skills . After you speak with Kara, you may have to speak with her again and ask for training directly. After that, you can start the next part of the quest chain.

Dune: Awakening
13
9.6 /10
Released
June 10, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

item.title: 9 Sims 4 Mods That Add New Careers, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Mods add unique careers like paranormal investigator & royal family for Sims players seeking new gameplay.
  • Career mods offer custom interactions, progression, and goals, adding variety beyond EA's contributions.
  • From Zoo Keeper to Game Developer, mods like Psychologist and YouTuber add modern, realistic career options.

With the amount of expansion packs and DLC for The Sims 4 , there are a decent number of career paths already available. But, with players looking for new playthroughs and choices, mods are a good place to look to add new careers to the game. Whether someone is looking for a realistic role or something more fantastical, there is something for every player.

Whether players want a playthrough with a paranormal investigator, a tattoo artist, or a royal advisor, there is a mod out there to make it happen. The careers donâ€™t just add variety, they also come equipped with custom interactions, progressions, and goals that would rival EAâ€™s contributions. Here are some of the best ones to try, many of which can be used at base game level or with very little DLC.

9 Paranormal Investigator Career

Ghoulish Charm

  • https://modthesims.info/d/687543/paranormal-career-gerson.html
  • By Gerson
  • Great for occult Sims

The Paranormal Investigator Career mod is inspired by the Paranormal Stuff Pack and adds more structure and variety to how ghost hunting happens in gameplay. Sims can accept jobs, earn a higher reputation per job, and unlock special ghost-hunting gear as they progress in their career.

This mod is a fun pick for players looking to try something less traditional and more unique. While it may be a more niche career type than some of these others, its offerings of chaos, humor, and suspense will spice up any Sim playthrough.

8 Zoo Keeper Career

For Animal Lovers

  • https://modthesims.info/download.php?t=612421
  • Piscean6
  • Perfect for nature-loving Sims

The Zoo Keeper Career mod puts Sims in charge of protecting, cleaning, and feeding animals at the local Zoo. This career ties in very well with the Cottage Living and Eco Lifestyle packs available, and includes its own unique moodlets about specific animal interactions.

This mod is a great addition for animal-loving players who want their Sims to have some fresh air in their careers. While this career can be seen as whimsical, it brings a charm and variety to the overall Sim job market that players will appreciate.

7 Psychologist Career

Counsel The World

  • https://kiarasims4mods.net/2020/07/19/psychologist-career/
  • By KiaraSims4Mods
  • Offers special events

The Psychologist Career mod puts Sims in a professional mental health setting, where they analyze patients, write up case files, and build trust with their recurring clients. There are also additional events tied to the mod, such as stress management and conflict resolution.

While not the most whimsical career, players looking to have fun with a Sim as a more serious doctor or one who meddles in everyone else's business will appreciate what this mod offers. Players will be able to bring a new medical side to their Sims' careers, without needing to take it too seriously.

6 YouTuber / SimsTuber Career

Home-Based Stardom

  • https://adeepindigomods.itch.io/simstuber-career
  • By adeepindigomods
  • Includes special niches

Sometimes, players want their Sims to seek fame and stardom, and sometimes the perfect way to do this is in front of a camera while working from home. The YouTuber/Simstuber Career mod helps level Sims up by creating videos, engaging with fans, managing their brand, and focusing on the right real-world content niches out there.

This mod feels relevant and fun, especially for those players looking to have a more modern playthrough. This career is ideal for Sims looking to find internet stardom, with a mix of fame, creativity, and being their own boss.

5 Mental Health Counselor Career

Empathy And Healing

  • https://kiarasims4mods.net/2022/06/26/mental-health-career/
  • By KiaraSims4Mods
  • Sims can specialize in therapy, counseling, or crisis response

The Mental Health Counselor Career mod may seem similar to the Psychologist above, but instead focuses on mental health struggles and working through those challenges with more realism and depth. Whether a Sim is struggling with a diagnosis, a relationship, or grief, this refreshing career adds both empathy and nuance to a game that typically tries to stay upbeat.

With unique storytelling opportunities and appropriate skill dependencies, this mod career allows players to explore something outside the usual science and business paths, into something more meaningful.

4 Royal Family Career

Monarch Life

  • https://kiarasims4mods.net/2021/07/18/royal-family-career-career/
  • By KiaraSims4Mods
  • Best when paired with royalty or medieval mods

The Royal Family Career is a unique pick for players looking for something that is roleplay-heavy and very dramatic from the outset. With a fully structured monarchy, Sims can be a noble-born sovereign, courtier, or squire. This mod in particular works well in playthroughs looking to take Sims back in time, or as a great storytelling challenge.

This mod is pure fun, and players who love legacy saves or kingdom builds will see this as a must. This career adds politics and grandeur to what can be seen as the everyday grind.

3 Tattoo Artist Career

Inked Entrepreneurs

  • https://www.patreon.com/posts/sims-4-tattoo-39928861
  • By marlynsims
  • Adds original tattoos, moodlets, and career events

The tattoo artist career mod helps Sims train their artistic eye and steady hand to become a world-renowned artist. Players can choose for their Sims to freelance in their own home or open a shop in the world, with a lot of creative options they can also choose from.

While this mod has seen some professional development with a new DLC pack, a base game career like this is still very unique and one that every player should be looking out for. It blends art and edgy to create a story players will want to do again and again.

2 Game Developer Career

Climb The Pixel Ladder

  • https://midnitetech.tumblr.com/post/690141445256003584/game-developer-career-semi-active
  • By Midnitetech
  • Includes realistic job titles

The Game Developer Career mod allows players to put their Sims into the fast-paced world of game development. Sims start as an intern in QA, building and climbing the ranks to become a lead designer, all the way up to being their own creative director with their own studio, depending on the path that they choose.

For players looking for tech-savvy careers, this is one of the best ones out there, with logical skill dependencies and clever career events. This could be the perfect choice for Sims looking to build their own stories in tech, rather than something more traditional.

1 Education Career Overhaul

Guide Future Generations

  • https://adeepindigomods.itch.io/education-overhaul
  • By adeepindigomods
  • Features in-depth daily tasks and teaching interactions

The Education Career Overhaul turns the base game education career and completely changes it for the better. Sims can now choose between different teaching roles that they prefer, interact with students through the lessons, plan and grade, and attend professional development.

This had to be the top of the list just because of how realistic and fleshed out the mod feels. Players looking to have family-based saves or wanting to have a career that is more slice of life feelings, this mod lets their Sims live out all of their teachers' dreams, with all the rewards and challenges.

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: 7 Best Horror Games Without Jumpscares
item.description:
Horror games have, for some time, been ruled by the jumpscare. With games like Five Nights At Freddy's leading the modern horror scene, it's not hard to see why their wild successes led to many attempts to replicate their formula. Despite this, there is a lot more to horror than a quick jump and a scream.

This list looks at titles within the horror gaming sphere that don't rely on jump scares for their horror. From slow, creeping, atmospheric horror to grotesque imagery that lingers longer than a player may like, these games are all worth playing for their unique brands of horror, with this list ranking them according to how well they cultivate that horror without resorting to jump scares.

7 Prey

Hunt, Or Be Hunted

Prey
9.3 /10
Released
May 5, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Arkane Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One
Powered by

Prey (2017) is an interesting game, not explicitly existing within the horror genre, but certainly adopting elements of it for its gameplay and atmosphere. As an FPS Immersive Sim, Prey tasks the player with surviving on a space station overrun by aliens with various powers, both physical and psychic, including shapeshifting into copies of inanimate objects that are scattered about the station.

The real sense of dread seen in Prey comes from not knowing where the Typhon aliens are. While this may seem like the perfect setup for a jumpy action game, Prey takes it in a much more methodical, strategic direction, causing the player not to be scared that an alien could jump out at any moment. Rather, the creeping dread that " that chair wasn't there before ", or " this room is different, but why? " lingers over everything, making the player second-guess everything about their surroundings, and their sanity.

6 Sunless Sea

Discover Creatures Beyond Comprehension

6 Images
6 Images
Sunless Sea
RPG
Adventure
Indie Games
Shooter
Systems
Released
February 6, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Linux, iOS, Android, Xbox One
Powered by

Sunless Sea couldn't be further from Prey. As a unique hybrid of text-based game and top-down shooter, Sunless Sea offers the player the opportunity to captain a steamship as they explore the seas of the world of Fallen London . Through this, they fight other naval vessels, monsters beyond their wildest comprehension, and the inevitable decay of sanity and the human body.

Sunless Sea combines Lovecraftian tropes and creatures with a narrative about the collapse of the world as we know it, and the constant looming threat of total insanity. Run out of food? Eat the crew. Do whatever it takes to survive. Die. Start again, and experience it all a little differently, with some roguelite elements making each playthrough feel a little different. While Sunless Sea isn't for everyone, it is an underappreciated gem.

5 Inscryption

Play Cards, Stay Alive

Inscryption
8.8 /10
Released
October 19, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Daniel Mullins Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5
Powered by

A slightly better-known title than Sunless Sea , Inscryption asks, " What if a madman living in the woods kidnapped people and forced them to play card games to earn their freedom? " It also answers this question, providing the player with a unique deck-building experience in which the player must solve puzzles between rounds of cards in order to defeat the mysterious hermit tormenting them. Being a roguelike game, Inscryption slowly ramps up in difficulty, introducing new concepts with each run.

While not the most popular deck-building game of recent years (everything being overshadowed by Balatro ), Inscryption is possibly the eeriest, most unnerving card game experience a gamer could ask for. One-part deck-builder, one-part escape room, and gambling with very limited lives make for a tense, chilling game well worth experiencing.

4 Mouthwashing

Stumble Into Madness

6 Images
6 Images
Mouthwashing
9.0 /10
Released
September 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Wrong Organ
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Mouthwashing took the internet by storm in 2024, receiving widespread praise for its powerful psychological horror imagery, intense narrative, and (somehow) charming art style. The game is played in first-person and feels somewhat like a walking simulator in which the player's surroundings become increasingly disturbing, unhinged, and tormented. There are some startling moments in Mouthwashing , but the game doesn't rely on jumpscares to achieve this. Rather, it continuously builds up its disturbing imagery as the characters and the player lose their grip on sanity.

Mouthwashing is a game that deals with some very disturbing themes, which are somewhat softened by the retro art style; however are explored in great depth. This game is unavoidably disturbing, from its visuals to its themes, to the slowly unraveling narrative told by an unreliable narrator.

3 Darkwood

Explore, Scavenge, Survive

6 Images
6 Images
Darkwood
7 /10
9.0 /10
Released
August 18, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Acid Wizard Studio
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PS4, PC, Switch
Powered by

Darkwood is a top-down survival horror game in which the player must explore the semi-open world during the day, scavenge resources, trade with NPCs, complete quests, and fortify their hideout. At night, they must defend their stronghold from intruders, with survival yielding reputation with traders and new story progression, and death yielding nothing. The narrative in this game features several endings, all affected by the player's actions, culminating in one of several fates for not only the player character but the world around them.

The horror in Darkwood is not only in its visuals, with the literal dark wood setting being full of disturbing things to find, and monsters surrounding the player each night. What causes the real sense of dread and horror within the game is the constant time pressure. Don't manage to fortify the base in time? Death is all that awaits. There are also several existential moments within the narrative that border on a sense of cosmic horror, which lends itself perfectly to this game that prides itself on its lack of jumpscares.

2 Faith: The Unholy Trinity

Unsettling And Disturbing Meets Rotoscope Pixel Graphics

Faith: The Unholy Trinity
Horror
Adventure
Systems
Released
October 21, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Airdorf Games
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Faith: The Unholy Trinity does involve some moments that could be classified as jumpcares, with terrifying rotoscope creatures barreling towards the player should they fail an encounter with an entity of some description. These are, however, few and far between, the game's pixel art style lending itself more to the sense of dread it creates than any form of direct visual horror.

The game tasks the player with taking control of a priest as he is put through several situations in which his faith is tested, and the end of the world hangs in the balance. The player has to piece together a lot of the narrative themselves through scraps of paper and vaguely remembered conversations. But what can be found is a narrative that truly brings faith into question, and forces the player to experience harrowing events through the eyes of pixel sprites.

1 World Of Horror

Something Between H.P. Lovecraft And Junji Ito

6 Images
6 Images
World of Horror
10.0 /10
Released
December 8, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Use of Alchohol and Tobacco, Violence
Developer(s)
panstasz
Platform(s)
PC, PS4, PS5, Switch
Powered by

World of Horror is a weird text-based, procedurally generated, roguelite RPG in which the player must uncover the supernatural goings on in one of several locations and defeat the entity that is plaguing the people of the area. Whether it be a ghost in a school, a demon in a shrine, or something a bit more human, World of Horror has something to unnerve almost any player.

Thanks to the largely text-based style of the game, much of the horror comes from the narratives, which are pieced together randomly from a collection of pre-written pieces by the developers. These are then supplemented by some of the best, most disturbing art on the market, heavily inspired by the works of the legendary Junji Ito. The player doesn't have these creatures jump at them for a moment, then disappear, instead, they are forced to stare at them for extended periods as they work through the convoluted UI, making for an unsettling experience at the best of times.

item.title: Dune: Awakening - Test of Cunning Quest Guide
item.description:
Joining the Great House Atreides in Dune: Awakening isn't all about strength and prowess. In the Test of Cunning quest, players are tasked with digging up some dirt on Maxim Kazmir, the Harko Representative rivaling Lieutenant Tolliver in The Anvil. Instead of violence, players will need to resort to charisma and deception in order to succeed.

This quest is part of the initiation phase for joining the Atreides in Dune: Awakening . It's a fairly short and simple mission that will take players to a Harkonnen checkpoint to the east. Thankfully, no fighting will be involved, and all players have to do is convince one of the Harko grunts to spill some of Kazmir's secrets.

Where to Find Lanov in Dune: Awakening Test of Cunning Quest

The target for this quest is Lanov, one of House Harkonnen's troopers stationed at Riftwatch, a large base leading to the base of the Hagga Rift that also houses the basic Mentat trainer. You can easily find Lanov by tracking the quest through the Journal menu. Doing so will highlight his location on your compass and the map as a quest marker.

You can get to Riftwatch fairly early on, as long as you use your Sandbike and stay away from open sand. From the Anvil, ride directly east until you reach the cliffs on the other side of the dunes. Then, either follow the cliff wall south, or climb the cliff until you reach the top. The path to Riftwatch should be clear and fairly straightforward.

Once you find Lanov, you'll have to interrogate him without raising suspicion . Lanov is a known Semuta addict, and it just so happens that he's taking a break. To successfully interrogate him, pretend to be an officer who's investigating the troops . Lanov won't know any better, and if you ask him about Maxim, he'll gladly spill the beans.

After you thoroughly investigate Lanov, go back to the Anvil and tell Tolliver what you learned . This marks the end of the quest, but you're not part of the team just yet. Before you become a House Atreides recruit, you'll need to finish one more quest for Tolliver, and unlike Test of Cunning, that one will involve fighting against some members of the Kirab somewhere in the desert.

By finishing all of Lt. Tolliver's tests, you'll become an official member of the Atreides, and with that, you'll be able to purchase faction-specific items from the quartermaster in Arrakeen. A new set of quests will also become available from Lt. Tolliver, if you want to further improve your standing with the house.

Dune: Awakening
13
9.6 /10
Released
June 10, 2025
